thread.title: Dangerous surf and fast showers for the weekend
thread.title_full: Dangerous surf and fast showers for the weekend

author: Glenn Glazer
title: Dangerous surf and fast showers for the weekend
text:
Gusty winds, big impacts for our weather
Dangerous surf and fast showers for the weekend
Gusty winds, big impacts for our weather
Dangerous surf and fast showers for the weekend
GO OUT THERE AND CHECK THAT OUT. LET ME SHOW YOU WHAT’S GOING ON HERE. AS WE LOOK AT OUR WEATHER HEADLINES AND WE’VE GOT VERY GUSTY WINDS IN THE FORECAST, IF YOU STEPPED OUTSIDE AT ALL TODAY, YOU KNOW THAT’S ALREADY HAPPENING. BIG WAVES, ROUGH SEAS, WARMER TEMPERATURES AND THE CHANCE FOR SOME FAST SHOWERS AS WE HEAD INTO THE WEEKEND. HERE’S A LOOK AT OUR CURRENT TEMPERATURES. WE ARE IN THE UPPER 60S ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. WE GOT INTO THE LOW 70S IN VERO BEACH, BUT WE STARTED THE DAY IN THE UPPER 40S. THE LOW THIS MORNING IN VERO 47 DEGREES, THE LOW IN WEST PALM 52. THAT’S TEN DEGREES BELOW AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. AND WE ENDED UP ABOUT THREE DEGREES BELOW AVERAGE FOR OUR DAYTIME HIGH. SO HERE ARE THE WINDS COMING IN AT 20, 2530 THREE MILES PER HOUR ALONG THE COAST RIGHT NOW. AND THAT IS GOING TO LEAD TO SOME BIG SURF OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. TOMORROW, ABOUT 5 TO 8 FOOT SEAS. BUT AS WE GET INTO THE WEEKEND, WE COULD BE TALKING ABOUT TEN, 11, 12 FOOT SEAS COMING IN ALONG THE COAST, HIGH RISK FOR RIP CURRENTS, SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT AND SEAS MIGHT NOT CALM DOWN UNTIL TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY OF NEXT WEEK ON THE FUTURE TRACK, THE CHANCE FOR SOME FAST MOVING SHOWERS. MOVING ON IN TOMORROW. IT’S ONLY ABOUT A 10 TO 20% CHANCE. IT’S ABOUT A 20 TO 30% CHANCE ON SATURDAY, AND ABOUT A 30% CHANCE ON SUNDAY FOR SOME SHOWERS COMING IN ALONG THE COAST. RIDING ON THOSE GUSTY NORTHEASTERLY WINDS. SO THE PALM BEACHES MARATHON IS ON SUNDAY. WE’RE LOOKING AT MILD TEMPERATURES IN THE MORNING AS RACE TIME STARTS AROUND 6 A.M. YOU CAN WATCH IT RIGHT HERE ON WPBF 25, BUT WE’RE ALSO LOOKING AT GUSTY WINDS AND THE CHANCE FOR A SHOWER WINDS OUT OF THE NORTHEAST. 17MPH AT 6 A.M., 16MPH, AND GUSTING HIGHER THAN THAT AT 8 A.M. AND 15MPH AT 10 A.M. SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR BOATERS, HIGH RISK FOR RIP CURRENTS. TONIGHT, TEMPERATURES IN THE LOW 60S ALONG THE TREASURE COAST, SOME UPPER 50S TO MID 50S INLAND AROUND THE NORTHERN PARTS AND EASTERN PARTS OF LAKE OR EASTERN SIDE OF LAKE OKEECHOBEE, AND THEN MID TO UPPER 60S ACROSS THE REST OF THE AREA. TOMORROW, HIGH TEMPERATURES WARMER THAN TODAY, MOSTLY MID 70S AND THEN BACK INTO THE UPPER 70S. WE GO ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. RAIN CHANCES COMING UP JUST A TICK ON SUNDAY TO 30%. SOME FAST MOVING SHOWERS COMING IN ALONG THE COAST. THAT GOES UP TO 40% BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK, BUT WE COULD SEE A REALLY STRONG COLD FRONT NEXT THURSDAY OR FRIDAY THAT KNOCKS OUR TEMPERATURES DO
Advertisement
Gusty winds, big impacts for our weather
Dangerous surf and fast showers for the weekend
Tonight, partly to mostly cloudy with a slight chance for a few coastal showers. Low temperatures in the mid to low 60s inland and along the Treasure Coast, and mid to upper 60s along the Palm Beach County coast, with breezy to gusty northeasterly winds.Friday partly to mostly cloudy skies and high temperatures in the mid 70s. Breezy to gusty northeasterly winds will create dangerous beach and boating conditions. A few fast showers coming in along the coast are possible.
